result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter M Swerdon Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted under jail rules.

AMENDED 8/12/15: 90 days jail previously ordered by the court to begin 9/25/15 shall be amended to begin 8/20/15

from Agent Corey Endreas requesting amendment to JOC - fax
JOC returned from 2383 Schultz St. #101, Portage marked  "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."

Defendant Walter M Swerdon in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yrs. probation, Conds: 90 days jail, huber granted, start Sept. 25, 2015 at 7 p.m. $518 costs, inclusive of DNA surcharge, complete AODA and follow all recommendations. Submit DNA sample.  Court granted 54  jail credit. Ct. 2 read in and dismissed.

Defendant Walter M Swerdon in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.

Defendant Walter M Swerdon by video, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond.  Standard felony conditions.  Waives time limits.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 02:10 pm.  Hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
